isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 Cab - Safety Belt System - Removal and Installation

calloutgroup.callout1: Shoulder safety belt guide upper anchor bolt
Safety belt retractor belt anchor bracket bolt

warning.para: All safety belt assemblies including retractors, belt tension sensor (BTS), if equipped, buckles, shoulder belt height adjusters (if equipped), child safety seat tether attachments and attaching hardware should be inspected after any collision. All new belt assemblies should be installed unless a qualified technician finds the assemblies show no damage and operate correctly. Belt assemblies not in use during a collision should also be inspected and new assemblies installed if either damage or incorrect operation is noted.

note.para: Driver side shown, passenger side similar.

step1.para: Remove the shoulder safety belt guide cover.
Remove the shoulder safety belt guide upper anchor bolt.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).

note.para: Note the safety belt retractor belt anchor bolt bracket anti-rotation locators on the floor pan when removing the lower anchor bolt for installation.

step1.para: Remove the safety belt retractor belt anchor bracket bolt.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).
Remove the safety belt retractor trim cover.

note.para: Note the position of the safety belt retractor upper locating tab for installation.

step1.para: Remove the safety belt retractor upper bolt.
• To install, tighten to 10 Nm (89 lb-in).
Remove the safety belt retractor lower bolt and the retractor.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Check the active restraint system for correct operation. For additional information, refer to Safety Belt System in this section.

warning.para: All safety belt assemblies including retractors, belt tension sensor (BTS), if equipped, buckles, shoulder belt height adjusters (if equipped), child safety seat tether attachments and attaching hardware should be inspected after any collision. All new belt assemblies should be installed unless a qualified technician finds the assemblies show no damage and operate correctly. Belt assemblies not in use during a collision should also be inspected and new assemblies installed if either damage or incorrect operation is noted.

step1.para: Position aside the floor mat.

note.para: Note the position and routing of the safety belt webbing and anchor bracket for installation.
Note the safety belt anchor bolt bracket anti-rotation locator on the floor pan for installation.

step1.para: Remove the safety belt anchor bracket bolt and the safety belt.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Check the active restraint system for correct operation. For additional information, refer to Safety Belt System in this section.

warning.para: All safety belt assemblies including retractors, belt tension sensor (BTS), if equipped, buckles, shoulder belt height adjusters (if equipped), child safety seat tether attachments and attaching hardware should be inspected after any collision. All new belt assemblies should be installed unless a qualified technician finds the assemblies show no damage and operate correctly. Belt assemblies not in use during a collision should also be inspected and new assemblies installed if either damage or incorrect operation is noted.

step1.para: Remove the upper shoulder safety belt guide cover.
Remove the shoulder safety belt guide upper anchor bolt.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).
Remove the shoulder height adjuster outer trim cover by pulling outward at the top of the trim panel and then lift up to release the trim panel lower hook.
Remove the shoulder height adjuster inner trim cover.

note.para: Note the position of the locator tab at the bottom of the shoulder height adjuster for installation.

step1.para: Remove the bolts and the shoulder height adjuster.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Check the active restraint system for correct operation. For additional information, refer to Safety Belt System in this section.

warning.para: All safety belt assemblies including retractors, belt tension sensor (BTS), if equipped, buckles, shoulder belt height adjusters (if equipped), child safety seat tether attachments and attaching hardware should be inspected after any collision. All new belt assemblies should be installed unless a qualified technician finds the assemblies show no damage and operate correctly. Belt assemblies not in use during a collision should also be inspected and new assemblies installed if either damage or incorrect operation is noted.

step1.para: Position the driver seat to its forwardmost position.
Position aside the floor mat.
Disconnect the safety belt buckle switch electrical connector.

note.para: Note the safety belt buckle anchor bolt bracket anti-rotation locator on the floor pan for installation.

step1.para: Remove the bolt and the safety belt buckle.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Check the active restraint system for correct operation. For additional information, refer to Safety Belt System in this section.

svcsubproc.title: Safety Belt Buckle - Passenger and Center

warning.para: All safety belt assemblies including retractors, belt tension sensor (BTS), if equipped, buckles, shoulder belt height adjusters (if equipped), child safety seat tether attachments and attaching hardware should be inspected after any collision. All new belt assemblies should be installed unless a qualified technician finds the assemblies show no damage and operate correctly. Belt assemblies not in use during a collision should also be inspected and new assemblies installed if either damage or incorrect operation is noted.

para.title: Passenger and center safety belt buckles

step1.para: Position aside the floor mat.

note.para: Be sure to note the routing of the safety belt buckle through the guide strap on the rear of the seat cushion to make sure of correct operation.
Note the safety belt buckle anchor bolt bracket anti-rotation locator on the floor pan for installation.

step1.para: Remove the safety belt buckle anchor bracket bolt from the safety belt buckle.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).

note.para: Note the position and the routing of the safety belt buckle webbing and anchor bracket for installation.

step1.para: Remove the safety belt buckle anchor bracket bolt and the safety belt buckle.
• To install, tighten to 41 Nm (30 lb-ft).

para.title: Passenger and Center safety belt buckles

step1.para: To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Check the active restraint system for correct operation. For additional information, refer to Safety Belt System in this section.
